required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Safety and Efficacy of the Dermal Filler "mARG-01-17" in Facial Rejuvenation Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Uncontrolled Single Center Study for the Evaluation of the Efficacy and Safety of the Dermal Filler "mARG-01-17" in the Facial Rejuvenation Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the clinical investigation is to evaluate the performance of the mARG-01-17 dermal filler in the context of its efficacy and safety.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is an open-label uncontrolled single-center study for the evaluation of the Performance (efficacy and safety) of the dermal filler "mARG-01-17" in the facial rejuvenation therapy. The design is of a not blinded, not randomized, single group.

primary_outcome.measure: The absolute change in Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between Day 0 to Day 90 (up to 12 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: A 5-point scale rating global aesthetic improvement in appearance, compared to pre-treatment, as judged by the Principal Investigator. Grade 1 - Exceptional improvement, grade 5 - Worsened.
The frequency and severity of adverse events (AEs)

secondary_outcome.measure: The absolute change in Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale (GAIS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between Day 0 and Days 15, 30, 45, 60 (up to 2, 4, 6 and 8 weeks respectively)
secondary_outcome.description: A 5-point scale rating global aesthetic improvement in appearance, compared to pre-treatment, as judged by the Principal Investigator. Grade 1 - Exceptional improvement, grade 5 - Worsened.

secondary_outcome.measure: The change in Wrinkle Severity Ranking Scale (WSRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Between Day 0 and Days 15, 30, 45, 60 and 90 (up to 2, 4, 6, 8 and 12 weeks respectively)
secondary_outcome.description: A validated five-point reference scale with photographs for evaluation of the skin condition that classifies deep facial wrinkles, like the nasolabial folds. as judged by the Principal Investigator.Grade 1 - the Best result, grade 5 - being the worst result.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 15, 30, 45, 60 and 90 (up to 2, 4, 6, 8 and 12 weeks respectively)
secondary_outcome.description: A subject questionnaire including 5 point scale to evaluate the participant's satisfaction - 1 being very much improved and 5 - worsened.

arm_group.description: Name of the investigation medical device: mesohyal ARGIBENONE Code of the MD for the purpose of the clinical investigation: mARG-01-17 GMDN code: 59131 mARG-01-17 is a dermal filler recommended for cutaneous filling, facial wrinkle improvement and general condition of the skin, which is administered by intradermal injections. It encourages repair and restructuring of skin tissue, reducing the signs of aging.
